column5: Wow.....  stiff and sore but all if GREAT when you have a real good day on the ice.  Fished east side of Simcoe today on about 8 inches of ice in 16 FOW and had non stop action all day long. Seen hundreds of perch swim under hole today with some real monsters.  All fish caught sight fishing with jiggin rap WC3 in silver. SLOWWWWWWWWWWWWW hovering, not jigging key.  Released 2 dozen at 13 inches and kept count of 11 inches. Landed well over 150 today. Best bite 9-11am. Slippery, bring cleats.
Nice catch sounds like you had a good day  rob
Great report, maybe we should have headed to the other side today  Nice catch there bud.  Joey

Well done man !!! great fishing today for sure.  ...we landed about 25 keepers today that was it,and i lost a pike,we were on the gilford side,i guess we should have been over there,thanks for the info !!...cheers
Great stuff Mark !
Damn Mark those are some impressive fish.  Well done.
Thanks. Caught more Smallmouth today then the day we were out.
I guess it's on east side of main lake. Great report, thanx.
Good job, I guess there are still some true jumbos in Simcoe.
sounds like a great day,congrats
WTG, sounded and looks like you had a ton of fun.
Hehe go figure - go bass fishing get perch, go perch fishing get bass.  Thats fishing for you
Wow some fat fish for sure.150 sounds like a great day.
Nice job.
Those are HUGE!  Good shootin'.
I should have met up with you Ranger!! Dammit!!! LOL! Nice Job!
Those are very impressive bud. Nice haul,great eats.
great pics thanks for sharing!  Cheers!
Awesome Report!!!!  Thanks for sharing!!!!!  Hope to get into some sows tomorrow!!!!!!
Great fish Ranger. Congrats.
Nice work! The Gilford area was working too; we caught over 200 during the day; here's a sampling of some of the better ones that came home with us.
Good to see some better sized fish making it to the dinner table compared to the babies that were so common last year...
